headline: Walmart in Mexico posts weaker-than-expected 7% dip in Q1 net profit
summary: Walmex Chief Executive Officer Ignacio Caride said in a video message the quarter was hit by challenging macroeconomic conditions and negative comparative effects, such as the Semana Santa holiday taking place in the second quarter instead of the first.  The company reported a 1.4% rise in same-store sales in Mexico and 1.9% growth in Central America.  It added 17 stores in Mexico and three in Central America.

raw.headline: Walmart in Mexico posts weaker-than-expected 7% dip in Q1 net profit
raw.summary: Walmex Chief Executive Officer Ignacio Caride said in a video message the quarter was hit by challenging macroeconomic conditions and negative comparative effects, such as the Semana Santa holiday taking place in the second quarter instead of the first.  The company reported a 1.4% rise in same-store sales in Mexico and 1.9% growth in Central America.  It added 17 stores in Mexico and three in Central America.

headline: Walmart, Target resume business with some Chinese factories after tariff-related halt, suppliers say
summary: Walmart and Target have resumed business with some of their Chinese suppliers, after pausing orders for a few weeks due to uncertainties over the imposition of steep US tariffs, two Chinese factories have told CNN.

headline: How grocery continues to drive Walmart’s bottom line
summary: The category brought in $276 billion in net sales in fiscal 2025, up nearly 12% from the same period two years ago, the retailer said in its annual report.
